cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 335 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the eastern Gulf, then turning northeast after landfall and tracking across Georgia and the Carolinas toward the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Panama City–Apalachicola area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Fernandina Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Georgia/Brunswick coast (Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings confined to FL Panhandle)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, inland Alabama/Georgia, Southeast Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (40–60 mph) possible Wednesday night into Thursday as the center passes inland west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–2 ft possible due to onshore flow; major surge not expected on the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash flooding in and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands, rough surf and hazardous seas affecting vessel operations.
